main event: On 2nd February 1958 at the Head of Penncove Bay, Whidbey Island, Washington, a ground-visual UFO sighting took place, lasting for 3 minutes. The observed object appeared as a round, medium-sized light that changed from dull red to high-intensity blue-white.
interesting points: The sighting was reported to involve a medium-sized light that changed color from dull red to high-intensity blue-white.
The object was described as not behaving like a flare or meteor and moved too slowly for such explanations.
The report states that there were no high clouds to the south during the sighting.
The sighting was witnessed by Lt. Con Holden of VP50 Naval Air Station, Whidbey Island.
The documents affirm that there were no photographs taken, despite the initial claim of 'PHOTOS: Yes'.
location: Head of Penncove Bay, Whidbey Island, Washington
witnesses: Lt. Con Holden of VP50 Naval Air Station
